wall.documentation: Description of the torus wall and its interaction with the plasma

wall.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

wall.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

wall.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

wall.description_2d.documentation: Set of 2D wall descriptions, for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary (gas tight vs wall with ports and holes, coarse vs fine representation, single contour limiter, disjoint gapped plasma facing components, ...). A simplified description of the toroidal extension of the 2D contours is also provided by using the phi_extensions nodes.

wall.description_2d[:].limiter.documentation: Description of the immobile limiting surface(s) or plasma facing components for defining the Last Closed Flux Surface.

wall.description_2d[:].limiter.type.documentation: Type of the limiter description. index = 0 for the official single contour limiter and 1 for the official disjoint PFC structure like first wall. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on index =2

wall.description_2d[:].limiter.type.inde.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

wall.description_2d[:].limiter.unit[:].c.documentation: Flag identifying whether the contour is closed (1) or open (0)

wall.description_2d[:].limiter.unit[:].o.documentation: Irregular outline of the limiting surface. Do NOT repeat the first point for closed contours
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

wall.description_2d[:].limiter.unit[:].p.documentation: Simplified description of toroidal angle extensions of the unit, by a list of zones defined by their center and full width (in toroidal angle).  In each of these zones, the unit outline remains the same. Leave this node empty for an axisymmetric unit. The first dimension gives the center and full width toroidal angle values for the unit. The second dimension represents the toroidal occurrences of the unit countour (i.e. the number of toroidal zones).
Index in the error_description list for "phi_extensions"

wall.description_2d[:].limiter.unit[:].r.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "resistivity"

wall.description_2d[:].mobile.documentation: In case of mobile plasma facing components, use the time-dependent description below this node to provide the full outline of the closest PFC surfaces to the plasma. Even in such a case, the 'limiter' structure is still used to provide the outermost limiting surface (can be used e.g. to define the boundary of the mesh of equilibrium reconstruction codes)

wall.description_2d[:].mobile.type.index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

wall.description_2d[:].mobile.unit[:].cl.documentation: Flag identifying whether the contour is closed (1) or open (0)

wall.description_2d[:].mobile.unit[:].ou.documentation: Irregular outline of the mobile unit, for a set of time slices. Do NOT repeat the first point for closed contours
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

wall.description_2d[:].mobile.unit[:].ph.documentation: Simplified description of toroidal angle extensions of the unit, by a list of zones defined by their center and full width (in toroidal angle).  In each of these zones, the unit outline remains the same. Leave this node empty for an axisymmetric unit. The first dimension gives the center and full width toroidal angle values for the unit. The second dimension represents the toroidal occurrences of the unit countour (i.e. the number of toroidal zones).
Index in the error_description list for "phi_extensions"

wall.description_2d[:].mobile.unit[:].re.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "resistivity"

wall.description_2d[:].type.documentation: Type of the description. index = 0 for equilibrium codes (single closed limiter and vessel); 1 for gas-tight walls (disjoint PFCs with inner vessel as last limiter_unit; no vessel structure); 2 for free boundary codes (disjoint PFCs and vessel)

wall.description_2d[:].type.index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

wall.description_2d[:].vessel.documentation: Mechanical structure of the vacuum vessel. The vessel is described as a set of nested layers with given physics properties; Two representations are admitted for each vessel unit : annular (two contours) or block elements.

wall.description_2d[:].vessel.type.documentation: Type of the vessel description. index = 0 for the official single/multiple annular vessel and 1 for the official block element representation for each vessel unit. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on index=2

wall.description_2d[:].vessel.type.index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

wall.description_2d[:].vessel.unit[:].an.documentation: Annular representation of a vessel layer by two contours, inner and outer
Inner vessel outline. Do NOT repeat the first point for closed contours
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Outer vessel outline. Do NOT repeat the first point for closed contours
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Index in the error_description list for "resistivity"

wall.description_2d[:].vessel.unit[:].el.documentation: Toroidal current induced in this block element
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Outline of the block element. Do NOT repeat the first point for closed contours
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Index in the error_description list for "resistance"
Index in the error_description list for "resistivity"

wall.description_ggd.documentation: Set of 3D wall descriptions, described using the GGD, for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary (gas tight vs wall with ports and holes, coarse vs fine representation, ...).

wall.description_ggd[:].ggd.documentation: Wall physics quantities represented using the general grid description, for various time slices.

wall.description_ggd[:].ggd[:].power_den.documentation: Power density arriving on the wall surface, for various wall components (grid subsets)
Interpolation coefficients, to be used for a high precision evaluation of the physical quantity with finite elements, provided per element in the grid subset (first dimension).
Index in the error_description list for "coefficients"
Index of the grid used to represent this quantity
Index of the grid subset the data is provided on
One scalar value is provided per element in the grid subset.
Index in the error_description list for "values"

wall.description_ggd[:].ggd[:].temperatu.documentation: Temperature of the wall, for various wall components (grid subsets)
Interpolation coefficients, to be used for a high precision evaluation of the physical quantity with finite elements, provided per element in the grid subset (first dimension).
Index in the error_description list for "coefficients"
Index of the grid used to represent this quantity
Index of the grid subset the data is provided on
One scalar value is provided per element in the grid subset.
Index in the error_description list for "values"

wall.description_ggd[:].grid_ggd.documentation: Wall geometry described using the Generic Grid Description, for various time slices (in case of mobile wall elements). The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the timebase on which physical quantities are described (../ggd structure). Grid_subsets are used to describe various  wall components in a modular way.

wall.description_ggd[:].grid_ggd[:].grid.documentation: Set of bases for the grid subset. For each base, the structure describes the projection of the base vectors on the canonical frame of the grid.
Index in the error_description list for "jacobian"
Contravariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_contravariant"
Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_covariant"
Space dimension of the grid subset elements. This must be equal to the sum of the dimensions of the individual objects forming the element.
Set of elements defining the grid subset. An element is defined by a combination of objects from potentially all spaces
Set of objects defining the element
Index of the space from which that object is taken

Grid subset identifier
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) nodes : All nodes belonging to the associated spaces
2) faces : All faces belonging to the associated spaces
3) x_aligned_faces : All x-aligned (poloidally) aligned faces belonging to the associated spaces
4) y_aligned_faces : All y-aligned (radially) aligned faces belonging to the associated spaces
5) cells : All cells belonging to the associated spaces
6) x_points : Nodes defining x-points
7) core_cut : y-aligned faces inside the separatrix connecting to the active x-point
8) PFR_cut : y-aligned faces in the private flux region connecting to the active x-point
9) outer_throat : y-aligned faces in the outer SOL connecting to the active x-point
10) inner_throat : y-aligned faces in the inner SOL connecting to the active x-point
11) outer_midplane : y-aligned faces connecting to the node closest to outer midplane on the separatrix
12) inner_midplane : y-aligned faces connecting to the node closest to inner midplane on the separatrix
13) outer_target : y-aligned faces defining the outer target
14) inner_target : y-aligned faces defining the inner target
15) core_boundary : Innermost x-aligned faces
16) separatrix : x-aligned faces defining the active separatrix
17) main_chamber_wall : x-aligned faces defining main chamber wall outside of the divertor regions
18) outer_baffle : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the outer active divertor region
19) inner_baffle : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the inner active divertor region
20) outer_PFR_wall : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the outer active divertor region
21) inner_PFR_wall : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the inner active divertor region
22) core : Cells inside the active separatrix
23) sol : Cells defining the main SOL outside of the divertor regions
24) outer_divertor : Cells defining the outer divertor region
25) inner_divertor : Cells defining the inner divertor region
26) core_sol : x-aligned faces defining part of active separatrix separating core and sol
27) full_main_chamber_wall : main_chamber_wall + outer_baffle(s) + inner_baffle(s)
28) full_PFR_wall : outer_PFR__wall(s) + inner_PFR_wall(s)
29) core_cut_X2 : y-aligned faces inside the separatrix connecting to the non-active x-point
30) PFR_cut_X2 : y-aligned faces in the private flux region connecting to the non-active x-point
31) outer_throat_X2 : y-aligned faces in the outer SOL connecting to the non-active x-point
32) inner_throat_X2 : y-aligned faces in the inner SOL connecting to the non-active x-point
33) separatrix_2 : x-aligned faces defining the non-active separatrix
34) outer_baffle_2 : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the outer non-active divertor region
35) inner_baffle_2 : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the inner non-active divertor region
36) outer_PFR_wall_2 : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the outer non-active divertor region
37) inner_PFR_wall_2 : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the inner non-active divertor region
38) intra_sep : Cells between the two separatrices
101) outer_mid_plane_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at outer mid-plane
102) inner_mid_plane_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at inner mid-plane
103) outer_target_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at outer active target
104) inner_target_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at inner active target
105) outer_target_separatrix_2 : Point on non-active separatrix at outer non-active target
106) inner_target_separatrix_2 : Point on non-active separatrix at inner non-active target
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.
Metric of the canonical frame onto Cartesian coordinates
Index in the error_description list for "jacobian"
Contravariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_contravariant"
Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_covariant"

wall.description_ggd[:].grid_ggd[:].iden.documentation:
Grid identifier
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) linear : Linear
2) cylinder : Cylinder
3) limiter : Limiter
4) SN : Single null
5) CDN : Connected double null
6) DDN_bottom : Disconnected double null with inner X-point below the midplane
7) DDN_top : Disconnected double null with inner X-point above the midplane
8) annulus : Annular domain
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

wall.description_ggd[:].grid_ggd[:].spac.documentation: Set of grid spaces

Type of coordinates describing the physical space, for every coordinate of the space. The size of this node therfore defines the dimension of the space. The meaning of these predefined integer constants can be found in the documentation of the grid service library
Type of space geometry (0: standard, 1:Fourier)
Verbose description
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.
Short string identifier

Space identifier
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) primary_standard : Primary space defining the standard grid
2) primary_staggered : Primary space defining a grid staggered with respect to the primary standard space
Verbose description
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.
Short string identifier

Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described.
Set of objects for a given dimension
Set of  (n-1)-dimensional objects defining the boundary of this n-dimensional object
Index of this (n-1)-dimensional boundary object
List of indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object. An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on a boundary
Geometry data associated with the object. Its dimension depends on the type of object, geometry and coordinate considered.
Index in the error_description list for "geometry"
Lower error for "geometry"
Upper error for "geometry"
Measure of the space object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects,...)
Index in the error_description list for "measure"
Lower error for "measure"
Upper error for "measure"
List of nodes forming this object (indices to objects_per_dimension(1)%object(:) in Fortran notation)

wall.description_ggd[:].type.documentation: Type of wall: index = 0 for gas tight and 1 for a wall with holes/open ports

wall.description_ggd[:].type.index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

wall.global_quantities.electrons.gas_puf.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "gas_puff"

wall.global_quantities.electrons.particl.documentation: Particle flux from the plasma (in equivalent electrons)
Index in the error_description list for "particle_flux_from_plasma"
Particle flux from the wall corresponding to the conversion into various neutral types (first dimension: 1: cold; 2: thermal; 3: fast), in equivalent electrons
Index in the error_description list for "particle_flux_from_wall"

wall.global_quantities.electrons.power_i.documentation: Electron power on the inner target
Index in the error_description list for "power_inner_target"

wall.global_quantities.electrons.power_o.documentation: Electron power on the inner target
Index in the error_description list for "power_outer_target"

wall.global_quantities.electrons.pumping.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "pumping_speed"

wall.global_quantities.neutral.documentation: Quantities related to the various neutral species

wall.global_quantities.neutral[:].elemen.documentation: List of elements forming the atom or molecule
Index in the error_description list for "a"
Number of atoms of this element in the molecule
Index in the error_description list for "multiplicity"
Index in the error_description list for "z_n"

wall.global_quantities.neutral[:].gas_pu.documentation: Gas puff rate for that species
Index in the error_description list for "gas_puff"

wall.global_quantities.neutral[:].label.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. H, D, CD4, ...)

wall.global_quantities.neutral[:].partic.documentation: Particle flux from the plasma for that species
Index in the error_description list for "particle_flux_from_plasma"
Particle flux from the wall corresponding to the conversion into various neutral types (first dimension: 1: cold; 2: thermal; 3: fast)
Index in the error_description list for "particle_flux_from_wall"

wall.global_quantities.neutral[:].pumpin.documentation: Pumped particle flux for that species
Index in the error_description list for "pumping_speed"

wall.global_quantities.neutral[:].recycl.documentation: Energy recycling coefficient corresponding to the conversion into various neutral types (first dimension: 1: cold; 2: thermal; 3: fast)
Index in the error_description list for "recycling_energy_coefficient"
Particle recycling coefficient corresponding to the conversion into various neutral types (first dimension: 1: cold; 2: thermal; 3: fast)
Index in the error_description list for "recycling_particles_coefficient"

wall.global_quantities.neutral[:].sputte.documentation: Effective coefficient of chemical sputtering for various neutral types (first dimension: 1: cold; 2: thermal; 3: fast)
Index in the error_description list for "sputtering_chemical_coefficient"
Effective coefficient of physical sputtering for various neutral types (first dimension: 1: cold; 2: thermal; 3: fast)
Index in the error_description list for "sputtering_physical_coefficient"

wall.global_quantities.neutral[:].wall_i.documentation: Wall inventory, i.e. cumulated exchange of neutral species between plasma and wall from t = 0, positive if a species has gone to the wall, for that species
Index in the error_description list for "wall_inventory"

wall.global_quantities.power_density_inn.documentation: Maximum power density on the inner target
Index in the error_description list for "power_density_inner_target_max"

wall.global_quantities.power_density_out.documentation: Maximum power density on the outer target
Index in the error_description list for "power_density_outer_target_max"

wall.global_quantities.power_from_plasma.documentation: Power flowing from the plasma to the wall
Index in the error_description list for "power_from_plasma"

wall.global_quantities.power_inner_targe.documentation: Total ion (summed over ion species) power on the inner target
Index in the error_description list for "power_inner_target_ion_total"

wall.global_quantities.power_to_cooling_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "power_to_cooling"

wall.global_quantities.temperature_error.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "temperature"

wall.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

wall.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

wall.ids_properties.creation_date.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

wall.ids_properties.homogeneous_time.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0 or 1) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, this node must still be filled, and set to 1 (by convention).

wall.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

wall.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)

wall.ids_properties.version_put.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS

wall.ids_properties.version_put.access_l.documentation: Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS

wall.ids_properties.version_put.data_dic.documentation: Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS
